page.title: 10SHOPS AND SHOPPING
page.content: In our village there are six food shops, a post office, a newsagent and a hardwareshop. A quarter of the people in Youlgrave go to Bakewell market weekly, a tenth go fortnightly, a few go monthly and half go very occasionally. Approximately a third of the familes shop for food in the village, half the familes go to a supermarket and other shops elsewhere. Bakewell is the most popular place for shopping with Matlock in second place and about a tenth go to Chesterfield and a tenth go to Buxton. Three quarters of the familes shop weekly for food. Nearly every family in the village has a fridge and 66% use a deep freeze. Outside delivery food services to houses include fishmonger, greengrocer, pork butcher, flour merchant, soft drinks and ice cream. Katherine Lucarotti (9)
